qas.question: What did geographical zones encourage the sharing of?
What did people in the same reason adopt?
Where did millennia of coexistence produce a culture with advanced agricultural and social patterns?
How long was there a homogeneous culture on the North American plains?
What creature did the nomadic hunter-gatherers of the plains hunt?

context: <a0_0>Cultural practices<a0_0/> in the Americas seem to have been shared mostly within geographical zones where unrelated peoples adopted <a1_0>similar technologies and social organizations<a1_0/>. An example of such a cultural area is <a2_0>Mesoamerica<a2_0/>, where millennia of coexistence and shared development among the peoples of the region produced a fairly homogeneous culture with complex agricultural and social patterns. Another well-known example is the North American plains where <a3_0>until the 19th century<a3_0/> several peoples shared the traits of nomadic hunter-gatherers based primarily on <a4_0>buffalo<a4_0/> hunting.
